metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15606 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Including trailing white space in HTTP header values in Nodejs 10, 12, and13 causes bypass of authorization based on header value comparisons

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15606` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nodejs - 8.10.0~dfsg-2ubuntu0.4+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nodejs package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.10.0~dfsg-2ubuntu0.4+esm2').
